code: @Manual{,   title = {mapindia: Plot Map of the Indian Subcontinent},   author = {Shubham Dutta},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0, https://www.shubhamdutta.com/mapindia/},   url = {https://github.com/shubhamdutta26/mapindia}, }

what: Plot Map of the Indian Subcontinent
title: Plot Map of the Indian Subcontinent
text: goal mapindia simplify mapping Indian subcontinent. convenient functions plotting choropleths, visualizing spatial data, handling state/district codes. Note: 3-digit district codes merged 2-digit state codes create 5-digit district code.

title: Plot Map of the Indian Subcontinent
text: can install development version mapindia GitHub :

title: Plot Map of the Indian Subcontinent
Plot Map of the Indian Subcontinent
text: Plot basic map Indian subcontinent states districts:  Visualize zones Central Eastern Zonal Councils:  Visualize individual states West Bengal Tamil Nadu:  Use data visualizations well:
code: library(mapindia) library(ggplot2) states <- plot_map("states") +   geom_sf(fill= "antiquewhite") +   theme(panel.grid.major =            element_line(color = gray(.5), linetype = "dashed", linewidth = 0.2),          panel.background = element_rect(fill = "aliceblue"))  districts <- plot_map("districts") +   geom_sf(fill= "gray") +   theme(panel.grid.major =            element_line(color = gray(.5), linetype = "dashed", linewidth = 0.2),          panel.background = element_rect(fill = "aliceblue"))  cowplot::plot_grid(states, districts, nrow = 1) central <- plot_map("states", include = .central, exclude = "UK", labels = TRUE) +   geom_sf(fill= "antiquewhite")  east <- plot_map("states", include = .east, labels = FALSE)  cowplot::plot_grid(central, east, nrow = 1) mh <- plot_map("districts", include = "MH")  tn <- plot_map("state", include = "Tamil Nadu", labels = FALSE)  cowplot::plot_grid(mh, tn, nrow = 1) statepop2011 <- plot_map("states", data = statepop, values = "pop_2011") +   scale_fill_continuous(low = "blue", high = "yellow", guide = "none")  wbpop2011 <- plot_map("districts", data = wb_2011, values = "pop_2011", include = "WB") +   scale_fill_continuous(low = "green", high = "red", guide = "none")  cowplot::plot_grid(statepop2011, wbpop2011, nrow = 1)

what: Retrieve states or districts using codes — code_info
title: Retrieve states or districts using codes — code_info
text: Retrieve states districts using codes

title: Retrieve states or districts using codes — code_info
code: code_info(code11, sortAndRemoveDuplicates = FALSE)  # S3 method for class 'numeric' code_info(code11, sortAndRemoveDuplicates = FALSE)  # S3 method for class 'character' code_info(code11, sortAndRemoveDuplicates = FALSE)

title: Retrieve states or districts using codes — code_info
text: code11 one three digit, either numeric character, vector odes look states districts. States two digit code districts five digit code (first 2 numbers pertain state). sortAndRemoveDuplicates Whether sort output remove duplicates. default, output returned order values provided codes parameter. Set parameter TRUE return output sorted codes single instance code.

title: Retrieve states or districts using codes — code_info
text: data frame states counties associated codes. `codes` omitted, data frame containing available states  returned.

title: Retrieve states or districts using codes — code_info
code: code_info(2) #>   abbr code           stname #> 1   HP   02 Himachal Pradesh code_info("02") #>   abbr code           stname #> 1   HP   02 Himachal Pradesh code_info(c("02", "03", "04")) #>   abbr code           stname #> 1   HP   02 Himachal Pradesh #> 2   PB   03           Punjab #> 3   CH   04       Chandigarh  code_info(19335) #>        stname abbr          dtname  code #> 1 West Bengal   WB Purba Bardhaman 19335 code_info(c("19335", "19337"), sortAndRemoveDuplicates = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   stname      abbr  dtname                    code  #>   <chr>       <chr> <chr>                     <chr> #> 1 West Bengal WB    North Twenty Four Pargan* 19337 #> 2 West Bengal WB    Purba Bardhaman           19335

what: Retrieve codes for either a India state or district — codes
title: Retrieve codes for either a India state or district — codes
text: state district unique two five digit code   code respectively. Use function obtain code state   district.

title: Retrieve codes for either a India state or district — codes
Retrieve codes for either a India state or district — codes
text: state state(s) obtain code(s).  Can entered either state abbreviation full name (case-insensitive). `state` can entered either single state vector states.  `state` vector, `district` must omitted. district county obtain code. Can entered without "district" (case-insensitive).

title: Retrieve codes for either a India state or district — codes
text: code(s) given state district. states entered, vector length equal number states returned. states found invalid, `NA` returned place. state district entered, single value code given district returned. district invalid given state, error thrown. `state` `district` omitted, entire list available codes returned, sorted state's abbreviation.

title: Retrieve codes for either a India state or district — codes
text: State district codes two five digit codes, respectively.   uniquely identify states districts within India. state   district codes merged one code 5 digits. first two digits   five digit district codes correspond state district   belongs .

title: Retrieve codes for either a India state or district — codes
text: state must included searching district,  otherwise multiple results may returned duplicate district names.

title: Retrieve codes for either a India state or district — codes

what: Gets code11 info for either states or districts depending on input. Helper function for S3 method [code_info()]. — get_code_info
title: Gets code11 info for either states or districts depending on input. Helper function for S3 method [code_info()]. — get_code_info
text: Gets code11 info either states districts depending input. Helper function S3 method [code_info()].

title: Gets code11 info for either states or districts depending on input. Helper function for S3 method [code_info()]. — get_code_info
Retrieve India map data — map_india
text: Retrieve India map data

title: Retrieve India map data — map_india
code: map_india(   regions = c("states", "state", "districts", "district"),   include = c(),   exclude = c() )

title: Retrieve India map data — map_india
text: regions region breakdown map, can one ("states", "state", "districts", "district"). default "states". include regions include resulting map. regions "states"/"state", value can either state name, abbreviation code. districts, district codes must provided can multiple districts name. states provided districts map, districts included states returned. exclude regions exclude resulting map. regions "states"/"state", value can either state name, abbreviation code. districts, district codes must provided can multiple districts name. regions listed include parameter applied first exclude regions removed resulting map. excluded regions present included regions ignored.

title: Retrieve India map data — map_india
text: data frame India map coordinates divided desired regions.

what: Join district or state level data to India mapping data — map_with_data
title: Join district or state level data to India mapping data — map_with_data
text: Join district state level data India mapping data

title: Join district or state level data to India mapping data — map_with_data
code: map_with_data(data, values = "values", include = c(), exclude = c(), na = NA)

title: Join district or state level data to India mapping data — map_with_data
text: data data joined India map. parameter data frame consisting two columns, code (2 characters state, 5 characters district first 2 characters correspond respective state) value associated region. columns data must code state value `values` parameter. code state provided, function uses code. values name column contains values associated given region. default "values". include regions include resulting map. regions "states"/"state", value can either state name, abbreviation code. districts, district codes must provided can multiple districts name. states provided districts map, districts included states returned. exclude regions exclude resulting map. regions "states"/"state", value can either state name, abbreviation code. districts, district codes must provided can multiple districts name. regions listed include parameter applied first exclude regions removed resulting map. excluded regions present included regions ignored. na value inserted states districts value data. value must type value column data.

title: Join district or state level data to India mapping data — map_with_data
text: data frame composed map data frame ([map_india()]) except   extra column containing values data included. result can plotted using [ggplot2::ggplot()] [plot_map()].

title: Join district or state level data to India mapping data — map_with_data
code: data_01 <- data.frame(code = c("01", "02", "04"), values = c(1, 5, 8)) df <- map_with_data(data_01, na = 0)  data_02 <- data.frame(state = c("AP", "WB", "Tamil Nadu"), values = c(6, 9, 3)) df <- map_with_data(data_02, na = 0)

title: mapindia coordinate reference system — mapindia_crs
text: coordinate reference system (CRS) represents canonical projection used mapindia package. can used transform shape files, spatial points, spatial data frames, etc. coordinate representation used plot_map function.

what: Convert spatial data to mapindia projection — mapindia_transform
title: Convert spatial data to mapindia projection — mapindia_transform
text: Converting spatial object map coordinates   allow points line regular mapindia plot applying   World Geodetic System 1984 projection points well. input `data` assumed contain longitude latitude coordinates   default. case, provide [sf::st_crs] object   `crs` parameter appropriate coordinate reference system.

title: Convert spatial data to mapindia projection — mapindia_transform
code: mapindia_transform(data, ...)  # S3 method for class 'sf' mapindia_transform(data, ...)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' mapindia_transform(data, ..., input_names = c("lon", "lat"))

title: Convert spatial data to mapindia projection — mapindia_transform
text: data data frame containing coordinates two column format first column represents longitude second data frame represents latitude. names data frame column matter, just order columns kept intact. ... Additional parameters passed onto [sf::st_as_sf]. default, `crs = sf::st_crs(4326)` used, implying longitude latitude coordinates. input_names character vector length two specifies longitude latitude columns input data (ones transformed), respectively. required input data `data.frame` object. Defaults `c("lon", "lat")`.

title: Convert spatial data to mapindia projection — mapindia_transform
text: `sf` object containing transformed coordinates   input data frame World Geodetic System 1984 projection applied.   transformed columns appended data frame   original columns remain intact.

title: Convert spatial data to mapindia projection — mapindia_transform
code: data <- data.frame(   lon = c(77.10, 88.36, 80.27, 72.87, 77.59, 78.03),   lat = c(28.71, 22.57, 13.08, 19.07, 12.97, 30.31),   pop = c(8398748, 2325502, 3990456, 2705994, 32113, 347397) )  # Transform data transformed_data <- mapindia_transform(data)  # Plot transformed data on map library(ggplot2)  plot_map() + geom_sf(   data = transformed_data,   aes(size = pop),   color = "red", alpha = 0.5 )

title: Transform `sf` coordinates to `mapindia` transform — perform_transform
text: Internal function common functionality transforming coordinates. Using function directly recommended.

what: Conveniently plot basic India map — plot_map
title: Conveniently plot basic India map — plot_map
text: Conveniently plot basic India map

title: Conveniently plot basic India map — plot_map
code: plot_map(   regions = c("states", "state", "districts", "district"),   include = c(),   exclude = c(),   data = data.frame(),   values = "values",   theme = theme_map(),   labels = FALSE,   label_color = "black",   label_size = 4,   ... )

title: Conveniently plot basic India map — plot_map
text: regions region breakdown map, can one ("states", "state", "districts", "district"). default "states". include regions include resulting map. regions "states"/"state", value can either state name, abbreviation code. districts, district codes must provided can multiple districts name. states provided districts map, districts included states returned. exclude regions exclude resulting map. regions "states"/"state", value can either state name, abbreviation code. districts, district codes must provided can multiple districts name. regions listed include parameter applied first exclude regions removed resulting map. excluded regions present included regions ignored. data data frame containing values plot map. parameter data frame consisting two columns, code (2 characters state, 3 characters district) value associated region. columns data must code state value `values` parameter. values name column contains values associated given region. default "value". theme theme used plotting map. default theme_map ggthemes. labels Whether display labels map. Labels displayed default. label_color color labels display. Corresponds color option [ggplot2::aes()] mapping. default "black". label_size size labels display. Corresponds size option [ggplot2::aes()] mapping. default 4. color options. ... arguments pass [ggplot2::aes()]. often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like color = "red" linewidth = 3. affect appearance polygons used render map (example fill color, line color, line thickness, etc.). color/colour, fill, linewidth specified set default values color="black", fill="white", linewidth=0.4.

title: Conveniently plot basic India map — plot_map
text: [ggplot2::ggplot] object contains basic   US map described parameters. Since result ggplot   object, can extended [ggplot2::Geom] layers, scales, labels,   themes, etc.

title: Conveniently plot basic India map — plot_map
code: plot_map()  plot_map(regions = "states")  plot_map(regions = "districts")  plot_map(regions = "state")  plot_map(regions = "district")   # Output is ggplot object so it can be extended # with any number of ggplot layers library(ggplot2) plot_map(include = c("GJ", "MH", "MP", "UP")) +   labs(title = "Indian States")

what: Indian Population (census and projections) by states — statepop
title: Indian Population (census and projections) by states — statepop
text: Indian Population (census projections) states.    data formatted easy merging output [mapindia::map_india()].

title: Indian Population (census and projections) by states — statepop
Indian Population (census and projections) by states — statepop
text: data frame 36 rows 8 variables.

title: Indian Population (census and projections) by states — statepop
text: code11 2-digit state code. abbr 2-letter state abbreviation. state full state name. pop_1901 1901 population estimate (number people). pop_1951 1951 population estimate (number people). pop_2011 2011 population estimate (number people). pop_2023 2023 population estimate (number people). pop_2024 2024 population estimate (number people).

what: Merge while maintaining original sort order — static_merge
title: Merge while maintaining original sort order — static_merge
text: Internal function used [code_info()].

title: Merge while maintaining original sort order — static_merge
Convenient theme map — theme_map
text: creates nice map theme use [plot_map()]. originated `ggthemes` package located repository:   https://github.com/jrnold/ggthemes. function manually rewritten avoid need  another package import.

what: West Bengal population, sex-ratio, and literacy data (2011) — wb_2011
title: West Bengal population, sex-ratio, and literacy data (2011) — wb_2011
text: West Bengal population, sex-ratio, literacy data 2011.    data formatted easy merging output [mapindia::map_india()].

title: West Bengal population, sex-ratio, and literacy data (2011) — wb_2011
West Bengal population, sex-ratio, and literacy data (2011) — wb_2011
text: data frame 23 rows 8 variables.

title: West Bengal population, sex-ratio, and literacy data (2011) — wb_2011
text: code11 5-digit code corresponding district. abbr 2-letter state abbreviation. district full district name. pop_2011 2011 population estimate (number people). pop_increase_2011 2011 population increase (percent people). sex_ratio_2011 2011 sex ratio (females per 100 males). literacy_per_2011 2011 literacy percentage. pop_2011 2011 population density (unknown units).

title: mapindia 0.1.0
text: Initial CRAN submission.
